page.title: 01FORDINGBRIDGE.
page.content: {Fordingbridge}is situated in a rural area of{Hampshire}between the {New Forest}and{Cranborne Chase.}It is on the northern bank of the{River {Avon,}some 11 miles south of Salisbury and 6 miles north of Ringwood. As the name suggests, the original settlement was founded around a ford.The bridge which spans the river dates from 1268 A.D. and has seven arches. The town has three state schools: Fordingbridge County Infant and Junior Schools and The Burgate Comprehensive School. Sandle Manor is an independent preparatory school for boys and girls. St. Mary's is the Parish Church. Fordingbridge is also served by a Roman Catholic Church, a Methodist Church, a United Reformed Church and a Salvation Army Hall. It has adequate shopping and recreational facilities. The Town Hall houses the library.
